meanings.definition: A long, flexible tube used for conveying water.
meanings.sent1: The gardener used the hosepipes to water the plants.
meanings.sent2: The hosepipes in the garden were green and coiled neatly.
meanings.sent3: When the hosepipes tangled up, it looked like a snake slithering around.
meanings.sent4: The hosepipes snaked through the yard, bringing life to the dry soil.
meanings.sent5: The children played with the hosepipes, pretending they were firefighters saving the day.

meanings.sent1: Dad will hosepipes the flowers in the evening to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent2: She hosepipes the lawn every morning to make sure the grass stays green.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to hosepipes the unsuspecting dog during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter quickly hosepipes the burning building to extinguish the flames.
meanings.sent5: The farmer had to hosepipes the crops during the dry spell to prevent them from withering.
